name: TableCollection
description: Represents a collection of all the tables that are part of the workbook or worksheet, depending on how it was reached.

properties.name: count
properties.description: Returns the number of tables in the workbook.

methods.name: getItem
methods.description: Gets a table by Name or ID.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: Name or ID of the table to be retrieved.

methods.name: getItemOrNullObject
methods.description: Gets a table by Name or ID. If the table does not exist, will return a null object.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: Name or ID of the table to be retrieved.

methods.name: getCount
methods.description: Gets the number of tables in the collection.

methods.name: getItemAt
methods.description: Gets a table based on its position in the collection.

parameters.name: index
parameters.description: Index value of the object to be retrieved. Zero-indexed.

methods.name: add
methods.description: Create a new table. The range object or source address determines the worksheet under which the table will be added. If the table cannot be added (e.g., because the address is invalid, or the table would overlap with another table), an error will be thrown.

parameters.name: address
parameters.description: A Range object, or a string address or name of the range representing the data source. If the address does not contain a sheet name, the currently-active sheet is used.

parameters.name: hasHeaders
parameters.description: Boolean value that indicates whether the data being imported has column labels. If the source does not contain headers (i.e,. when this property set to false), Excel will automatically generate header shifting the data down by one row.
